comment: Smart Data Models - CSV Dialect adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.FrictionlessData/master/CSVDialectFrictionlessData/schema.json
description: The CSV dialect descriptor.Converted for Smart Data Models initiative from original frictionless data

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: caseSensitiveHeader
contents.comment: Case Sensitive Header. Use of case in source CSV files is not always an intentional decision. For example, should 'CAT' and 'Cat' be considered to have the same meaning. Specifies if the case of headers is meaningful

contents.name: commentChar
contents.comment: Comment Character. Specifies that any row beginning with this one-character string, without preceding whitespace, causes the entire line to be ignored

contents.name: csvddfVersion
contents.comment: CSV Dialect schema version. A number to indicate the schema version of CSV Dialect. Version 1.0 was named CSV Dialect Description Format and used different field names

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: delimiter
contents.comment: Delimiter. A character sequence to use as the field separator

contents.name: doubleQuote
contents.comment: Double Quote. If Double Quote is set to true, two consecutive quotes must be interpreted as one. Specifies the handling of quotes inside fields

contents.name: escapeChar
contents.comment: Escape Character. Specifies a one-character string to use as the escape character

contents.name: header
contents.comment: Header. Specifies if the file includes a header row, always as the first row in the file

contents.name: lineTerminator
contents.comment: Line Terminator. Specifies the character sequence that must be used to terminate rows

contents.name: nullSequence
contents.comment: Null Sequence. Specifies the null sequence, for example, \ and then 'N'

contents.name: quoteChar
contents.comment: Quote Character. Specifies a one-character string to use as the quoting character

contents.name: skipInitialSpace
contents.comment: Skip Initial Space. Specifies the interpretation of whitespace immediately following a delimiter. If false, whitespace immediately after a delimiter should be treated as part of the subsequent field

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
